text.name: sys_description
text.text: The BBC Micro, is a series of microcomputers designed by Acorn Computers in 1981. It was the spearhead of the 'computer literacy' project launched by the BBC following a documentary in which Dr Christopher Evans predicts the coming of the computer revolution and its impact on the UK. The BBC is equipped with an 8 bit processor at 3 Mhz and 16 to 128 kB of RAM with upgrades. It can display 640x256 in 16 colors, play mono sound on 4 channels, voice synthesis, has an optical pen, analog and digital inputs.
